means: 旧时在英国使用的金币
[人名] [英格兰人、苏格兰人姓氏] 诺布尔绰号，来源于中世纪英语、古法语，含义是“出身高贵的，高贵的，杰出的”(highborn,distinguished,illustrious)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都含有"宏伟壮丽的"之意。
means: grand ： 侧重规模大，豪华而宏伟壮丽、盛大。也可指人的崇高、伟大。
magnificent ： 指环境、建筑物等本身的壮丽、堂皇、庄严、崇高或出色等。
majestic ： 侧重状态、外表、仪态等给人以威严感。
splendid ： 指人在行为、品德或性格等方面的卓越超群；指物侧重外观上的辉煌。用于口语中，作"极好的，绝妙的"解。
noble ： 指因本身著名或从外表上看有令人难忘的华丽、庄严、卓越、雄壮或崇高。

sentence.Network_en: He had implicit faith in the noble intentions of the Emperor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对皇帝陛下高尚的动机深信不疑。

sentence.Network_en: Cockburn's arrival coincided with that of Sir Iain and Lady Noble.
sentence.Network_cn: 科伯恩到时正好伊恩爵士和诺布尔夫人也来了。

sentence.Network_en: We'll always justify our actions with noble sounding theories.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们总会用听起来非常高尚的理论为我们的行动辩护。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin (g)nobilis 'noted, high-born', from an Indo-European root shared by know

entry.def: If you say that someone is a noble person, you admire and respect them because they are unselfish and morally good.

example.ex: He was an upright and noble man who was always willing to help in any way he could...
example.tran: 他是一个正直高尚的人，总是愿意尽其所能帮助他人。

example.ex: I wanted so much to believe he was pure and noble.
example.tran: 我非常愿意相信他是纯洁高尚的。

entry.tran: (想法、目标、行动等)高尚的,崇高的
entry.def: If you say that something is a noble idea, goal, or action, you admire it because it is based on high moral principles.

example.ex: He had implicit faith in the noble intentions of the Emperor...
example.tran: 他对皇帝陛下高尚的动机深信不疑。

example.ex: We'll always justify our actions with noble sounding theories...
example.tran: 我们总会用听起来非常高尚的理论为我们的行动辩护。

entry.tran: 壮观的;宏伟的;卓越的;优质的
entry.def: If you describe something as noble, you think that its appearance or quality is very impressive, making it superior to other things of its type.

example.ex: ...the great parks with their noble trees.

entry.def: Noble means belonging to a high social class and having a title.

example.ex: Although he was of noble birth he lived as a poor man.
example.tran: 虽然他出身贵族，却过着穷人的日子。

entry.def: In former times, people who belonged to a high social class and had titles such as 'Baron' or 'Duke' were referred to as nobles .

example.ex: More and more nobles made Moscow their home during Catherine's reign.
example.tran: 在叶卡捷琳娜大帝统治时期，越来越多的贵族移居莫斯科。

means.word_mean: 1. a titled peer of the realm
3. of or belonging to or constituting the hereditary aristocracy especially as derived from feudal times;
4. having or showing or indicative of high or elevated character;

sentences.sentence: "a noble gas such as helium or neon"
"noble metals include gold and silver and platinum"

auth_sentence.content: Is the survival of billions a less noble goal?

sentences.en: He is a noble man, we all admire him.
sentences.cn: 他是一个道德高尚的人, 我们都敬佩他。

sentences.en: His attempt to save the poor people's homes was truly noble.
sentences.cn: 他拯救穷人家园的尝试确实非常高尚。

sentences.en: It was very noble of you to look after your old neighbour when she was sick.
sentences.cn: 你的心真好, 你的老邻居生病时你一直照料她。

means.word_mean: 庄严的，宏伟的，壮丽的，雄伟的

sentences.en: Niagara falls is a noble sight.
sentences.cn: 尼亚加拉瀑布是一壮观的景色。

means.word_mean: (头衔、地位、身份等)显贵的，高贵的

sentences.en: He was descended from a noble family.
He was nobler than his neighbours.
sentences.cn: 他比他的邻居出身高贵。

sentences.en: When the nobles rebelled, the king battled them.
sentences.cn: 当贵族谋反时, 国王便出兵攻打他们。
警方抓住了六名犯罪嫌疑人。

jushi.english: Few noble persons ever spoke to those of humble origins but to give an order.
jushi.chinese: 贵人们除了发号施令以外很少跟出身卑贱的人说话。

jushi.english: His noble ideas and polite behavior are laudable.
jushi.chinese: 他崇高的思想和彬彬有礼的举止令人赞美。

jushi.english: He framed his life according to a noble pattern.
jushi.chinese: 他以高尚的模式构筑自己生活的框架。
